subject: Law
title: The Equal Protection Clause
description: A fast breakdown of The Equal Protection Clause for builders.

hook.text: One sentence in the 14th Amendment has generated more Supreme Court cases than almost any other constitutional line.

buildup.text: The Equal Protection Clause says no state shall deny any person 'the equal protection of the laws.'

discovery.text: Courts use three levels of scrutiny: strict (race), intermediate (gender), and rational basis (most other laws).

twist.text: It originally targeted racial discrimination. Over time, courts applied it to gender, sexual orientation, and more.

climax.text: Strict scrutiny means the government must prove a compelling interest and use the least restrictive means possible.

punchline.text: Equal protection sounds simple. Applying it is anything but.

quiz.question: What level of scrutiny do courts apply to racial classifications?
